oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena

Class Oracle

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.spatial.rdf.client.jena.Oracle

  • public class Oracle
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages the RDBMS JDBC connection to an Oracle semantic store. Many convenience methods are provided to insert rows, execute SQL statements, etc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_INDEX_DOP 
      static int DEFAULT_OPT_DYN_SAMPLING

      The default name of the data source for Oracle semantic data management
      static int ORA_INVALID_ID 
      static int ORA_NAME_IN_USE_BY_EXISTING_OBJECT
      Oracle error code reported when a table or other name is already in use (already exists).

              java.lang.String user,
              java.lang.String pass)
        Constructs a new instance based on the JDBC connection and login information passed in.
        Parameters:
        url - JDBC URL that identifies an Oracle database
        user - username of a database schema
        pass - password to authenticate

    • Method Detail

      • cloneConnection

        public oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection cloneConnection()
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method returns a new instance of OracleConnection. Callers of this method are reponsible for closing the returned connection object.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • commitTransaction

        public void commitTransaction()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Persists changes made through this Oracle connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Closes the underlying JDBC connection after a rollback. If changes need to be persisted, be sure to issue a commitTransaction() call before this method call.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set. In case there is a SQLException caused by the query execution, then the statement will be closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL command
        Returns:
        The result set. The caller is responsible for closing the Statement backing the returned ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s,
                                       int iTimeout,
                                       int iDOP)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set. In case there is a SQLException caused by the query execution, then the statement will be closed automatically.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL command
        iTimeout - number of seconds the system will wait for execution to finish
        iDOP - degree of parallelism to execute the query.
        Returns:
        The result set. The caller is responsible for closing the Statement backing the returned ResultSet.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String s,
                                       int iTimeout,
                                       int iDOP,
                                       java.util.List listBindValues)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Throws:

      • executeQueryWithArg

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String arg)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes the given SQL statement with a bind variable. This method executes the given query and returns a query result set. The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set.
        Parameters:
        s - SQL statement to be executed
        arg - value of a bind variable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQueryWithArg

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String arg,
                                              java.lang.String arg2)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a SQL statement and returns a result set. The statement used to run the query is not closed (and cannot be closed in this method). The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set.
        Parameters:
        s - SQL statement to be executed.
        arg - value of the first bind variable
        arg2 - value of the second bind variable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeQueryWithArg

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQueryWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                              java.lang.String arg,
                                              java.lang.String arg2,
                                              java.lang.String arg3)
                                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Executes a SQL statement and returns a result set. The statement used to run the query is not closed (and cannot be closed in this method). The invoker of this method is responsible for closing the statement after consuming the result set.
        Parameters:
        s - SQL statement to be executed.
        arg - value of the first bind variable
        arg2 - value of the second bind variable
        arg3 - value of the third bind variable
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - when there is a server error.

      • executeUpdate

        public int executeUpdate(java.lang.String s)
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used for SQL INSERT and UPDATE operations, but not for statements that are batched.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL statement
        Returns:
        The value returned by Statement.execute(java.lang.String)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • executeUpdateWithArg

        public int executeUpdateWithArg(java.lang.String s,
                                java.lang.String arg1)
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Used for SQL INSERT and UPDATE operations, but not for statements that are batched.
        Parameters:
        s - the SQL statement
        arg1 - the first String argument
        Returns:
        The value returned by Statement.execute(java.lang.String)
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • getConnection

        public oracle.jdbc.OracleConnection getConnection()
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Returns the underlying OracleConnection object upon request. A new instance of OracleConnection will be created if this method is called for the first time.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if there is any problem establishing a connection to the server.

      • getOraclePoolName

        public java.lang.String getOraclePoolName()
        Returns the oracle pool object name if created from an OraclePool object.
        Returns:
        null or OraclePool object name

      • isDBReadOnly

        public boolean isDBReadOnly()
        Check if the Database is on read only mode flag.
        Returns:
        true if the database is opened in read only mode.

      • rollbackTransaction

        public void rollbackTransaction()
                         throws java.sql.SQLException
        Rolls back changes made through this Oracle connection.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setDBReadOnlyFlag

        public void setDBReadOnlyFlag()
        Check if the Database is on read only mode and set the flag

      • setLocale

        public static void setLocale()
        Set default locale using two Jena Adaptor specific JAVA VM properties

      • setSessionQueryDOP

        public void setSessionQueryDOP(int dop)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method sets the degree of parallel query execution at the session level.
        Parameters:
        dop - degree of parallelism. The value can be zero. If the value is negative, then it is no op.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
